result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL J ZIEMER

records.addlTxt: No contact with V1 or their residence in Omro PD report 22-1513. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.

3:14 PM Defendant MICHAEL J ZIEMER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicole A Morley & Kou Thao appeared by video for MICHAEL J ZIEMER.  Prosecuting attorney Adam Joseph Levin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. Advised of rights. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Defendant doesn't qualify for the Public Defender.  Record closed @ 320
